page.title: 11LOWESWATER FARMS, SHEEP
page.content: Most farms in this block keep both cattle & sheep, but sheep farming is predominant. Main breeds are Herdwicks at Brackenthwaite,Buttermere and Swaledales at Loweswater. Flocks are heafed to the fell & are transferred from one tenant/owner to subsequent ones. Each flock is identified by its individual ear and smit mark. It is traditional to winter away hoggs on lowland farms. Purebred lambs are reared as flock replacements. Halfbred gimmers from Leicester tups are sold to lowland farms as breeding ewes. Wethers are sold for fattening. Shearing is mostly contracted out & the wool is sold to the Wool Marketing Board. Cris Todd of Kirkgate breeds sheepdogs of international standard.
